content.title: Rashtriya Gram Swaraj Abhiyan
content.details: Rashtriya Gram Swaraj Abhiyan (RGSA) was launched on 24th April 2018 'National Panchayat Day' by the Hon'ble Prime Minister, an umbrella scheme of the Ministry of Panchayati Raj, Govt. of India. It is a unique scheme proposed to develop and strengthen the Panchayati Raj System across India in rural areas. The scheme aims to strengthen the capacities of institutions for rural local governance to become more responsive towards local development needs, prepare participatory plans leveraging technology, and efficiently utilize available resources for realizing sustainable solutions to local problems linked to SDGs.
benefits: Use of IT for Distance Learning & for e-Enablement of Panchayats
Gap-Filling Support of Economic Development & Income Enhancement
Technical Support including Human Resources (HR) based on Identified Gaps
Handholding Support by Academic Institutions/ Institutions of Excellence to GPs for Gram Panchayat Development Plan (GPDP) Formulation
Adequate Manpower at GP Level & to provide support for Technical Manpower
e-enablement of Panchayats for e-governance to enhance efficiency and transparency with thrust on Panchayat Enterprise Suite (PES) Applications developed by the Ministry
Electronic Fund Transfer (EFT), Public Finance Management System (PFMS), use and Geotagging of assets in Gram Panchayats
eligibility: Panchayati Raj Institutions of all the States/UTs are eligible.
Regular conduct of elections to Panchayats or local rural bodies in non-Part IX areas.
Not less than one third reservation for women in Panchayats.
Constitution of SFC every five years, and placement of Action Taken Report (ATR) on the recommendations of the SFC in the State legislature.
Constitution of District Planning Committees (DPCs) in all districts and issuing of Guidelines/rules to make these functional.
Preparation and submission of detailed annual State Capacity Building Plan for PRIs to MoPR.
Co-location of Common Service Centres (CSCs) with the Gram Panchayat buildings.
content.application_process: Online registration on Rashtriya Gram Swaraj Abhiyan Portal.
documents_required: Utilization Certificate as well as requisite documents in accordance with the extant rules of the GoI the provisions of GFR as applicable
Audit Report (conducted by an independent agency)

faqs.question: Which are the themes that cover under RGSA?
faqs.answer: Poverty-free and enhanced livelihoods village, Healthy Village, Child-friendly Village, Clean & Green Village, Self-Sufficient Infrastructure, Secured Village, Water Sufficient Village, Engendering Development in Village.

faqs.question: Which are the states/UT covered under RGSA?
faqs.answer: This scheme will extend to all states and UT of the country and will also include institutions of rural local government in non-part IX areas, where panchayat does not exist.

faqs.question: What are the central components?
faqs.answer: National Plan of Technical Assistance, Mission mode project on e-panchayat, Incentivization of Panchayats, Action Research & Media.

faqs.question: What is the type of the theme?
faqs.answer: RGSA is proposed to be implemented as a core Centrally Sponsored Scheme (CSS).
